p: The medicinal plant is endowed with bioactive secondary metabolites possessing antihyperglycemic properties such as alkaloids, phenols, flavonoids, tannins, terpenoids, steroids and saponins. Repeated oral administration of Moringa stenopetala (Baker f.) aqueous leaf extracts (250mg/kg and 500mg/kg) for 28 days has shown beneficial effects on antihyperglycemia, improved body weight, restore biochemical changes of blood, improve alloxan pancreatic damage. After further investigation it is possible to say that Moringa stenopetala (Baker f.) leaves can be exploited as an alternative herbal supplement for the management of diabetes.
